channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Hidden Trauma of Jury Duty
item.description: People who serve on disturbing cases can suffer mental health effects for years after a trial ends.

item.title: What We Know About the C.D.C. Shooting in Atlanta
item.description: A gunman who believed the Covid-19 vaccine had made him ill fired at the agency’s Atlanta offices, killing a police officer and rattling the public he...

item.title: How once-iconic Intel fell into a 20-year decline
item.description: It's CEO is under fire. It has lost its edge. And it's still the only U.S. company with the know-how to make leading-edge chips in America.

item.title: Air Force bid for Tesla Cybertrucks in target practice symbolizes the ‘evolving’ relationship between the Pentagon and Big Tech, expert says
item.description: The ballooning demand from the military for innovative technology creates a “whole new sector” friendly to BigTech, an American University professor t...

item.title: Sam Altman says the AI talent war is a bet that a ‘medium-sized handful of people’ will make superintelligence breakthroughs
item.description: "I'm not I'm not totally sure what's gonna happen, but it is a crazy intense comp for a very small number of people right now."

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Project United Front Ahead of Trump-Putin Summit
item.description: Washington’s push to negotiate an end to the war has raised concerns the Trump administration will make concessions to Moscow that Kyiv cannot accept.

item.title: Zuckerberg’s Compound Had Something That Violated City Code: A Private School
item.description: The school, called BBS, enrolled 14 children in kindergarten through fourth grade and employed three full-time teachers and other staff members.

item.title: Takeaways From The Times’s Reporting on Putin’s Powerful Aide

item.title: The Russian Technocrat Who Helps Enable Putin and Manage the Ukraine War
item.description: For three years, Sergei V. Kiriyenko has handled the political aspects of the war in Ukraine, rising among a cadre of skilled managers who oversee the...

item.title: In India, Immigration Raids Detain Thousands and Create a Climate of Fear
item.description: Officials have picked up people across the country, most of them Muslim, citing a national security risk. Rights groups say the raids are targeting de...

item.title: What Happened When Mark Zuckerberg Moved In Next Door
item.description: The billionaire has bought at least 11 properties in Palo Alto, Calif., creating a compound for his family, a private school for his children — and he...

item.title: Dmitri Kozak Was a Key Putin Aide. He Lost Power When He Balked at the Ukraine War.

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Project United Front Ahead of Trump-Putin Summit
item.description: Washington’s push to negotiate an end to the war has raised concerns the Trump administration will make concessions to Moscow that Kyiv cannot accept.

item.title: Ousted vaccine regulator Vinay Prasad to return to FDA
item.description: Laura Loomer, an ally of Donald Trump, had said Prasad was not aligned with the president’s agenda and has aggressively lobbied against his return.

item.title: Masked thieves stole all the Labubu dolls from a Los Angeles-area store. ‘We are still in shock’
item.description: The incident took place early Wednesday morning, and about $7,000 worth of Labubu dolls were stolen.
